subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Sunday, 01 July, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




West Ham sign Faubert for £6.1m
West Ham sign France midfielder Julien Faubert from Bordeaux for £6.1m.



 
Lampard rejects new Chelsea deal
Chelsea midfielder Frank Lampard turns down the offer of a new contract, BBC Sport understands.



 
Hargreaves completes Man Utd move
England midfielder Owen Hargreaves seals his move from Bayern Munich to Manchester United.








GOLF




Storm surges to French Open win
England's Graeme Storm clinches his maiden European Tour title with a one-shot victory in the French Open.



 
Ochoa makes US Women's Open move
World number one Lorena Ochoa moves to within one shot of the US Open lead before fading light halts the third round at Pine Needles.



 
French Open leaderboard
The fourth round is under way at the European Tour's French Open in Paris.








MOTORSPORT




Ferrari revival thwarts Hamilton
Ferrari's Kimi Raikkonen and Felipe Massa finish first and second in the French Grand Prix to end Lewis Hamilton's run of victories.



 
Hamilton upbeat for Silverstone
Lewis Hamilton believes McLaren can match Ferarri next weekend when he targets victory in the British Grand Prix.



 
French Grand Prix: As it happened
All the action as Kimi Raikkonen leads home a Ferrari one-two with Lewis Hamilton third for McLaren.

ATHLETICS




Pavey qualifies for World Champs
Britain's Jo Pavey qualifies for the World Championships after beating the 10,000 metres qualifying time in Watford.



 
Wanjiru gets set for Tyneside run
World half marathon record holder Sammy Wanjiru is confirmed as a participant in this year's Great North Run.



 
Celtic Cup gets McConnell backing
Scotland captain Lee McConnell is looking forward to the second Celtic Cup event on 31 July.








CYCLING




Thousands tackle 'Le Tour' route
Up to 5,000 riders are cycling the Tour de France route through London and Kent.



 
Brit Cavendish claims Tour spot
Britain's Mark Cavendish is named in T-Mobile's nine-man team for the Tour de France.



 
Wiggins seals Tour de France spot
Britain's Bradley Wiggins is named in Cofidis' nine-man team for next month's Tour de France.
